intro: Behen csereii f. elatior, commonly known as the silverleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. The flowers are typically pink or red and bloom throughout the growing season.
